website_summaries.verdict: While a very rugged mirror that can take a beating, some riders may feel uncomfortable with the limitations of the convex, stainless steel lens.
pros: Comes in 62 mm and 68 mm sizes
Very solid once installed and adjusted
Polished stainless steel lens won't break and resists scratching
cons: Installation can be a bit cumbersome and may involve cutting a hole in your grip
The combination of the stainless steel and slightly convex surface may not give you the best view of approaching potential problems

customer_reviews.title: Best bar end mirror yet.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best bar end mirror I've found. Works great on a my straight MTB bar and my wide drop bar. I like that it uses large standard allen screws to tighten and adjust instead of tiny Phillips heads. The plastic is also really tough. I need to put a more miles on it and let it same the ground a couple times (accidentally) to find any weaknesses. The best part is the mirror itself is very high quality and clear. Just like a automobile mirror.
customer_reviews.author: C. Peters

customer_reviews.title: Don't understand the good reviews
customer_reviews.text: I think this mirror is rubbish. I mean I really hate it. There is so much distortion and I find it really difficult to see anything. IF I can see something, I have to look more than once to identify if there is actually a car coming. I got the larger one. I does mount fine and the rotation(s) are fine, but that is pointless if the quality of the image is super poor. I am the nah sayer on this one. Don't get it. Problem is I don't think there is anything better.
customer_reviews.author: Write Good Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Don't ride without one!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! These mirrors are great. I brought two and installed them on the drops. They're out of the way and allow me to see approaching vehicles from behind. The reflection is sufficient for my cycling needs and the size is large enough that I can decipher dropped cyclist and approaching vehicles. Now in addition to lightening and feeling the pressure changes as a vehicle approaches, I now have the added security of seeing what's behind me.
customer_reviews.author: JD Donaldson Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Poor design! Breaks easy!
customer_reviews.text: You have to adjust frequently and during adjustment the rubber plug in the back comes out and the plastic breaks. There are many pictures of this in the one-star reviews. Mine broke within the first week and I was going to return it because you could tell it was a design flaw but my bike fell over and busted the busted mirror so I could not return it. Lucky vender!
customer_reviews.author: GB

customer_reviews.title: Cycling safety
customer_reviews.text: Very happy cyclist. Excellent product. Very easy to install and very easy to see oncoming traffic behind me. A must have for cycling safety.
customer_reviews.author: Buke

customer_reviews.title: Brilliantly designed, crucial for safety.
customer_reviews.text: I know I wrote one review back to amazon, but I'm not sure it was published, so here's the deal. This is an exceptionally clever and really durable mirror. The instructions have very few words, so if you're not a bike mechanic you need to look very closely at the very careful drawings included with the mirror to understand how you make this thing swell up inside your handlebars by turning a hex screw that pulls a plastic cylinder inward and over an angled cone that thus presses hard against the inside of your handlebars. The mirror stays perfectly in place, and adjusts 360 degrees. Its stainless steel mirror reflects whatever's behind you perfectly. I feel 100% safer with this.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but Distorted. Thumbs down.
customer_reviews.text: The product seems to be well made except for the mirror. It’s very distorted. Actually hurt my eyes looking into it for more than a couple seconds. It doesn’t seem to be damaged, it appears to be the construction and design. If they update the mirror this would be a nice compact product.
customer_reviews.author: Jon O

customer_reviews.title: ) Works great after installation
customer_reviews.text: The installation instructions (line drawing only) needs an explanation of when you insert the mirror stem into the end of your hand grip/handlebar, that the mechanism will expand (not visible from outside) in order to hold the mirror firmly in place. Keep turning the hex nut. try turning the hex nut before you insert it so you'll know which way to turn it once you insert it (if you turn it the wrong way you may have to get tweezers to get the parts out of the handlebar, put them back together and try again...it only took me one mistake.) Works great after installation.
customer_reviews.author: SewFocused

customer_reviews.title: Will be trying a different mirror.  I don’t recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: cost, didn’t break when it fell off during a ride. Cons: blurry view, small area of sight, fell off because the sizing fitting didn’t stay, trouble getting the fitting out of handlebars to try reinstall. If riding safety and rear vision is your top concern, I would recommend something different. My husband has a Cat Eye mirror. That’s my next stop.
customer_reviews.author: L. Warner

customer_reviews.title: this one is sturdy, metal
customer_reviews.text: I bought a basic plastic mirrow because it was cheaper.... you get what you pay for... it broke and never really worked well with distorted viewing.... this one is sturdy, metal, and has excellent viewing with no distortion.... relatively easy to install with a hex tool. Love when things work. The one draw back is that once you set it up, it is set and not adjustable... so you need to take on the street and set it to your specifications before tightening...
customer_reviews.author: strong opinions

customer_reviews.title: Stays in place.  Good view
customer_reviews.text: I love this mirror. I always look at the negatives people write and one guy said this mirror shook wildly to the extent he couldn't see. This is far from the case. I see a clear image and it stays in the position I move it to. I got the larger of the two mirrors (68 mm). If you are choosing between a helmet mounted mirror and bar mounted mirror, I would go with this. I tried the helmet mounted mirrors and it was always difficult to set and the mirror was so tiny, I would have to move my head around to see.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson Roykirk

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but another mirror works better for my trike.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mirror for my tadpole recumbent trike, my previous Mirrycle mirror broke when it lost an argument with a bollard. The Hafny mirror appears to be well built and was easy to install in my bar end. The mirror is stainless steel and should be able to take more abuse than the glass Mirrycle. Overall, however, I prefer the Mirrycle. You might have a different opinion on your bike. The Mirrycle is more adjustable in positioning so that your hand/arm aren't in the way. Also, on a tadpole trike you need to rest the trike on its side to work on the front wheels. The Hafny doesn't easily swing out of the way like the Mirrycle.
customer_reviews.author: GaryW

customer_reviews.title: Works OK.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good product. The stainless mirror is only so-so but good enough to see cars coming from behind, especially at night with headlights on. Construction quality seems good so far. Any slight touch on the mirror will move it so I pretty much have to tweak it any time I go out for a ride, but I'd rather have it move than snap off. Popped into the end of my handlebars with no problem, and tightened up nicely. So overall I'd say it was worth the dough.
customer_reviews.author: Ranman

customer_reviews.title: Constant Adjust!
customer_reviews.text: I like the metal mirror part and the fact that it is adjustable. I don't like that it is not easy to keep in one place. I have this on a road bike and have tightened all adjustments. Pretty much every ride I need to readjust a couple times due to bumps in road knocking it out of position. Also: I have drop handlebars and mirror ends up pretty low forcing you to remove eyes from road to see in it. Think I will try the helmet or eye wear variety. Not to happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: K. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Product lasted two weeks
customer_reviews.text: Product lasted only two weeks, very hard to see such a small mirror. Made out of poor quality plastic. This item should cost less than 8 dollars. Don't waste your money...
customer_reviews.author: Raf

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as it looks (update)
customer_reviews.text: The mirror seemed sturdy, well designed and easy to install. Unfortunately, the ring, which held the actual mirror kept falling out. After two, or three such events, I decided to glue the ring to the frame. Before I could do so, the mirror, along with the ring fell off again. This time it ended up in the bushes and couldn't be found. I am left with a useless mirror frame mounted at the end of the handlebar. UPDATE the seller of the mirror Bark Equipment came through and determined that the mirror has been improperly assembled by the manufacturer and sent me a new one free of charge.
customer_reviews.author: Marek Z

customer_reviews.title: Poor fit and quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mirror based upon reviews posted by previous buyers who said it was a good product. First off, it did not fit snugly into the handlebars of my old Raleigh mountain bike. I made it work by wrapping the base in electrical tape until it did. Once I got it mounted, the mirror was a great asset while riding. Very helpful for monitoring traffic coming up from behind. The problem is the whole thing kind of disintegrated after two weeks of riding. Bear in mind I'm just street riding so not really sure what happened. Although I would like to get another mirror for safety reasons, I would not buy this particular product again.
customer_reviews.author: siena21

customer_reviews.title: Too much vibration...
customer_reviews.text: Probably due to the large size. I'm evaluating the 62mm size. Even on a smooth road these mirrors vibrate. On rough roads the image is almost unusable. On the plus side, the quality is excellent. I would suggest a new size of perhaps 50mm or so. Large enough for a good view but small enough to minimize vibration. NOTE: I'm using these on a road bike with drop bars of carbon fiber. Maybe the ends of the bars are more prone to vibration than aluminum bars. Just a hypothesis. I'm doing a 50-mile club ride tomorrow then I'll decide whether or not to return these.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Clear mirror and easy to mount but shakes with road conditions.
customer_reviews.text: High quality glass mirror unlike many plastic mirrors. Easy to install. However on the end of the drop handles there is moderate vibration depending on road conditions. This makes the image hard to see. However this is great over no mirror and I can’t blame road conditions cause gong shaking on the mirror but it definitely can limit use. Making it tighter helps and it’s is more stable when I’m grasping (dampening) the lower grips.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon N.

customer_reviews.title: A nice little mirror
customer_reviews.text: I bought a used ebike (EVELO Delta X) with the mirror broken off and so I needed a replacement. Evelo lists one for about $10 more, so I thought I'd try saving a little money. It took about 30 seconds to install (it comes with an easily removed spacer for larger ID handlebars, which I didn't need), and my initial placement on the upright handlebars turned out to be perfect. I live on a dirt road, so the first (and last) mile is very bumpy, but this mirror stays very stable. The gently-convex mirror gives a nice wide view behind you with a quick glance. I'm very happy with it. I have not tried it on drop-down handlebars yet.
customer_reviews.author: Marc J Chabot

customer_reviews.title: really good bar end mirror
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation - I thought a rubber sleeve was missing, but no, it installed easily and securely. I've used Blackburn mirrors for many years and I like this one better! My Blackburn fell off during a ride and wasn't available. I'm glad that happened as I now have a rock solid mirror that's been steady for a number of rides. Don't be put off by the fact that it's a metal mirror and the warning that the image might not be perfectly clear. It's all good. There's no problem with those things. I've only used two bar end mirrors, but this one is the better of the two.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Z

customer_reviews.title: Sweet little mirror
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough good things about this mirror! Compact, yet great field of view. Fits neatly at the end of my mountain bike handle bar and doesn't interfere with climbing bar ends. No vibration at all while my hands are on the bars. Great mirror, very happy with it. 5 minutes to mount and adjust. Holds adjustment perfectly. Note: I'm riding exclusively on pavement, or hard packed smooth dirt trails.
customer_reviews.author: Readsalot

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install and adjust.
customer_reviews.text: Have 6 e-bikes and this is the first pair without extension. Found it can be very well adjusted to see well, without much interference and protrusion. It needs though frequent adjustments, but that's something I have not found on any model so far. Besides, every time you lean it against something, or load it into the car/truck - it will need a re-adjustment again. In all - like them the best. Today had a brush against a wall and the mirror fell out. Had no problem fitting it with the under-cover back into the frame and outside of a scratch, it fits perfectly again. The best pair and very inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Ahango

customer_reviews.title: Small Viewing Area w/ Distored View
customer_reviews.text: Add me to the group of dissatisfied customers. The basic problem is the mirror is much to small in size to provide any feeling of safety. The field of view of the mirrow was so small I found out that I cannot trust this mirror solely while trying to cross a road. I found it virtually useless. Unfortunately, I purchased it in the winter months and didn't get a chance to ue it on my bicycle. Now that I finally had a chance to use the mirror it's too late to return.
customer_reviews.author: Stone Jack

customer_reviews.title: Good construction quality, but poor mirror surface.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, and the mirror is stable. Unfortunately, the image is warped (beyond the expected fisheye effect) and therefore the mirror must be positioned perfectly in order for the reflected image to be clear. Cars sometimes approach quite closely behind me before I notice them (if they have their lights off). If the reflection were clearer, this would be five stars from me, but I don’t feel like I have a good rear view with this device, and I’m looking for a higher quality replacement. My safety is too important to not see what is behind me.
customer_reviews.author: Corinna C

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Essential Safety Item
customer_reviews.text: I especially like the unbreakable stainless steel mirror. Every once in a while, it's inevitable that every bike gets knocked over, or bumped. Previously purchased glass mirrors just didn't hold up. Much to my surprise, this highly polished stainless steel finish is equally clear and reflective as any glass mirror -- without the risk of breaking. Thumbs up to this highly useful safety item! Let's face it, some car drivers just seem blind to bikers. This mirror gives me a "heads up" to road traffic coming up from behind without having to turn my head for a rearward glance.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: Easy to adjust and it stays in place
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I installed this I wondered how I ever rode without one, haha. The mirror is easy to adjust and it stays where you adjust it to. I rode a 102 mile ride with it last weekend and it did not lose position at all over the course of the ride. The mirror finish is durable, as I accidentally knocked my bike over into the dirt while changing a flat and the mirror did not scratch.
customer_reviews.author: Bibbs

customer_reviews.title: Good Optics
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to riding. I live in a rural area and the roads do not have bike lanes - so I have to share the roads with cars going 50 mph. I found it very spooky riding not knowing who was behind me. This bar-end mirror installed in just a minute. It has good articulation so I can always get the mirror exactly where I want it - and it says put. The optics are good - not great - but I can clearly spot cars that are 1/4 mile away with lights and several hundred yards away without lights in the mirror. Riding with this bar-end mirror makes me a safer and more confident rider.
customer_reviews.author: Gary C

customer_reviews.title: Attractive and well-engineered
customer_reviews.text: No glass is a huge plus. The stainless mirror gives a clear view. (Remove the protective sheet!) The plastic housing is thoroughly adjustable and fit my riser bars perfectly without the spacer sleeve. Being able to fold the mirror out of the way (like on a car) is very useful when I stow my bicycle. I recommend initially installing the mirror snugly but loose enough in the handlebar so it can rotate. Adjust the mirror while riding and then tighten it. A bit of experimentation will yield good results. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: trickdog

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but a bit distorted
customer_reviews.text: I have had this mirror for about 2 months now and still have mixed feeling about it. It was easy to install, it fits nicely on the end of the bar, and it looks great. Problem is (as others have noted) this is not glass but rather polished steel. The reflection is petty distorted when you add in a bit of curvature to the lens. Don't get me wrong, you can see what is coming up behind you...just not all that clearly. I'm not sure why this bugs me...because as long as you know something is there then that is the purpose of a mirror. It still kinda does though.
customer_reviews.author: Me in Dallas

customer_reviews.title: I gotta see what's behind me
customer_reviews.text: I had a mirror like this before, but it broke. I couldn't find another like it at the stores, so I bought one of those mirrors that attach to the bike helmet. I didn't like that mirror. It was hard to spot what was behind me using that small mirror, and found myself trying to move my head and focus on that mirror that I lost focus of what was in front of me, so I got rid of the helmet mirror and got the side view handlebar mirror that I ordered off of Amazon. I like that it's polished stainless steel. This mirror lets me see what's behind me in a glance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very very nice
customer_reviews.text: This mirror works great. I can see the cars behind me easily now while riding on the road. It also helps with some peace of mind that you can tell if the car behind you sees you as well if they are moving over to pass. The mount seems fairly solid and the mirror doesnt bounce around or move out of position while riding. It of course does move some while hitting large bumps but stayed in position after. I'm very happy with this mirror. I have both the 68mm and the 62mm and do prefer the 68mm for how much farther you can see down the road behind you.
customer_reviews.author: Booie q minterkidd

customer_reviews.title: First Impression
customer_reviews.text: THIS (pic) is what actually came in the package. Then YOU get to figure out how to mount it into your handlebar. Easy, actually. took all of 5 minutes. Maybe I got lucky, and my rather generic Murray bike just took it, I dunno, I'm just pleased it was easy.. Seems reflective of what's behind me, and very east to adjust Pleased so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Hugger

customer_reviews.title: Great and functional rear view mirror!
customer_reviews.text: I've struggled finding a good mirror for my road bike. I have used another brand of handlebar mirror, but there wasn't a good way to "lock" it in place and I was constantly having to readjust it only to have it need adjusting some more, then it fell out after a few rides and was long gone. I've used some helmet mirrors, but find they block my view and also look kinda goofy. This one seems much better. Locks firmly in place even in my larger than average handlebars, and once tightened down, takes a good bump to get it to move! View is ample for what is needed.
customer_reviews.author: M. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great accessory!
customer_reviews.text: I'd been putting off finding a rearview mirror, especially after checking local bike shops for something I might like. After much research, I believe this is it. Really saves on wrenching your neck looking back if you're an older guy like me. After 3 rides with it, I've really gotten used to glancing down and spotting cars coming up behind me, which makes me feel much safer and helps adjusting to traffic. I had a moment of confusion when first trying to install in my 16.7mm inside diameter bars, but there is a removable expansion sleeve for larger diameter bars that is not mentioned in the minimal instructions. Excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: Kim from Fargo

customer_reviews.title: This is a very useful mirror which I use to make sure my wife ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very useful mirror which I use to make sure my wife is still behind me while riding. No matter how much you tighten it, though, the adjustment screw still comes loose after a while since it's impossible not to bang the mirror with your knee sometimes, which then requires that you move it back. Other than that, it's perfectly effective and I would recommend it to anyone who needs to see behind them without craning their neck. The view is tiny, and hard to see if the road is uneven, but it's enough to see what you really need to see, and it night it's even more obvious when cars or other bikes get close.
customer_reviews.author: John Wiegley

customer_reviews.title: Good view
customer_reviews.text: A mirror on the end of my handle bar was exactly what I needed. Hafny has designed one that is easy to install. It stays in position and gives me a glimpse of rear approaching traffic. The image in the mirror is clear. I like that it folds down so I can tuck it in when the bike is parked. It is well suited for my needs and the price was reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: P. Gavin

customer_reviews.title: Optical quality marginal but solid mount. Workable
customer_reviews.text: See the headline. I expected some distortion seeing as it is a steel and not glass mirror, and it has some of that distortion. The mounting and adjustability make up for that in my estimation. Rode with it on my cruiser and I have no vibration. The 62 mm viewing size is ok, too, for my 63 year old eyes. You have to scan this device more for motion than a 'target' but used correctly it is a good accessory to have. I thought about a helmet mounted mirror but then you have to always wear the helmet (and I don't).
customer_reviews.author: Timothy J. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: mirror mount elbow comes loose and then lose vehicle sight line
customer_reviews.text: Installed on a road bike, the mirror moves position due to road vibration and road irregularities- patched holes, asphalt cracks, cement seams etc (tightened several times and just not stable). As a result the vehicle view changes without notice so cars are just there becoming a car surprise for me, rather than me seeing them approach- results its unsafe for me. Not using anymore and trying to return (only mirrors that has ever worked for me is the blackburn bar end which is for mtn bikes) Will try helmet mounted mirror and see how that works. Wish it was sturdier as is a good concept- out of the way and keeps the handle bar usable, but too unstable
customer_reviews.author: Jimb

customer_reviews.title: CONFEX
customer_reviews.text: IT IS NOT CONVEX..its a nice 2" make-up..lipstick mirror...the quality of construction is great..fits perfect..very well made and useless...A bicycle handle bar is in motion all the time..your time available to "read" the mirror is a nono second...such a mirror is a quick reference for dangers..not fidelity or clarity...it MUST be convex..wide angle..this one is not...I bought one of those stick on auto mirror cheapys at an auto parts store and stuck it on the front..really convex...HELPFUL.Now...William...
customer_reviews.author: William Gough

customer_reviews.title: One of the best bike mirrors I’ve found.
customer_reviews.text: I tried other mirrors and this one is by far better than them all. It’s sturdy and doesn’t not move after you adjust it. Only rode by bike twice since installing but it works great. The size is perfect, not too small and not too big. I like that it doesn’t stick out that far but still shows everything directly behind me. One of the complaints was that the plastic cracks but I think that the key is do not over tighten the screws. I probably will buy this for my other bikes and my wife’s bike. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Evad

customer_reviews.title: Perfect mirror for my Brompton folding bike.
customer_reviews.text: This mirror works very well on my Brompton folding bike. I tightened the set screws so that the mirror did not move easily, but can still fold it down when I fold up the bike. By folding the mirror so that it is horizontal and just below the bar grip, the handlebars can fold down without the mirror hitting the ground. The attached pictures so the mirror on my bike with the bike unfolded and folded. The mirror extends out far enough that I can clearly see cars or cyclists coming up behind me. It is large enough that I can just make a quick glance to check behind me. The mirror does not vibrate when riding on normal roads.
customer_reviews.author: shdl

customer_reviews.title: Quality & easy installation
customer_reviews.text: This bar-end mirror was simple to install (allen wrench not included) and it appears to be well-built. I like how close it fits to the end of the bar and how, when not being used, it can be swiveled into a 'protective position' over top of the bar. The previous style mirror I owned stuck out about an inch or so and ended up getting broken when the bike fell over (due to my carelessness). With this new mirror, even if I were to get careless again, I think the mirror could survive a fall.
customer_reviews.author: MrTools

customer_reviews.title: good mirror
customer_reviews.text: i needed a decent mirror to see what's behind me and there was a few bad reviews about the mirror housing,here's some advice for the company,the mirror housing seems to be of softer plastic vs the mount that goes into the handlebar,if the mirror housing was made of the same material the whole thing would be almost bullet proof,here's some advice for customers who bought this,if you go to the store and you don't want the mirror broke fold it in,just in case of the bike falling over,not folding it in is just laziness and besides it's better to be aware instead of ignorant
customer_reviews.author: gtrplyer66

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't ride without it now
customer_reviews.text: I was a little on the fence when I first got the mirror installed and adjusted, but checking it instead of trying to rely on my limited range of vision (glasses wearer) when turning to see behind me has quickly become as second nature as checking my mirrors while driving. Vision provided by the mirror seems a little limited at first, but when adjusted properly you can see the entire street behind you. Not a complete replacement for hearing and situational awareness, but an enhancement to confirm approaching vehicles and their distance (although be aware that just as with your car mirrors, vehicles are closer than they appear).
customer_reviews.author: Productly Professor

customer_reviews.title: Very clear, stable mirror
customer_reviews.text: I have only good things to say about this mirror. I ordered the larger of the two options and I think that's the best way to go. I now no longer need to turn around to see if a car is behind me, and that makes my riding a whole lot safer. The two adjustment screws give me a great range of motion that allows me to tuck this mirror away when I need to and then extend it out quickly and easily. The quality of the materials used is very good and I feel this product will last me a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M.

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I don't think I'll ever have a bike without these bar end mirrors. Just keep in mind folks, you'll have to cut out a hole in your handlebar grips so these mirrors can slide inside the handlebar. If your handlebar grips can come off easily, its best to cut out the hole prior to installing them on the bar. Otherwise, happy slicing with scissors or an exacto knife. No need to lop off the entire end of the bar grip (that will look ugly). I simply cut out a hole big enough for these to slid in securely. It will look cleaner on your handlebar to have some of the rubber ends still intact. Just my opinion of course....
customer_reviews.author: Cruiser

customer_reviews.title: Does the job nicely
customer_reviews.text: The instructions turned up by email a week after the product, but as it took a week to get round to installing it this wasn't a problem and it was fairly obvious how to install it anyway. You need an Allen Key as it's not supplied but I had one in my cycle tool kit (probably designed that way). It was beautifully packaged for transport and arrived safely. Fits securely, very firm, hardly any vibration when riding on the road and remarkably easy to see things in despite the relatively small size. Well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Good, But Delicate
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally tipped over my bike and this mirror's housing shattered like a dinner plate. I was able to fix it with superglue and baking soda, but its never been the same. I really like having the mirror. Its a great size and works well to keep me safe on the road. I just wish it was built a bit stronger. Its absolutely my fault its broken, but durability on a bike accessory really should be a consideration, especially at the price of $20 (granted I paid $16, but still).
customer_reviews.author: Skiddlywinks

customer_reviews.title: Good mirror, but beware of fit!
customer_reviews.text: I am giving the product lower than 5 stars because the description was misleading. The description says minimum inner diameter of 14.8 mm. I measured my handlebar inner diameter thinking that this should fit. However, the images show a minimum fit of 17 mm, which I did not notice! Measure the inner diameter of your handlebar. If it is smaller than 17 mm, this mirror will not fit. Don't believe the 14.8 mm. I still like the mirror. I am using it on another bike. Great mirror if it fits.
customer_reviews.author: Tony L

customer_reviews.title: Assists like side view mirror of car would.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the mirror better than the one for the helmet! After getting over the initial application process(I cut a slight incision on the end of the handlebar rather than cutting it out completely) the mirror fit right and exact! Works just like a side view mirror of a car and actually a little better as it helps you see some of the opposite side as well depending on positioning. I would still recommend turning your head as you would in an actual car just to be as safe as possible but this product is a great help!
customer_reviews.author: Bigcraig

customer_reviews.title: Great Review Mirror
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mirror for my touring bike with drop handle bars. I am impress of how much of the road you can see behind you when riding on the road. It took some adjusting to get the right angle but you quickly figure it out. The mirror is steady so the slight vibration from the road is not giving that shaking view. I want to add that the packaging for this mirror is awesome. Hafny did a great job giving the mirror a great presentation. You will be happy if you chose to buy this item.
customer_reviews.author: PB Givens

customer_reviews.title: Good mirror, but didn't fit MY BIKE
customer_reviews.text: Have two of these. One fits my road bike no problem, the other does not fit my hybrid - which has bars that have an inside diameter of 16mm. My bad for not measuring this first, their bad for making this sound more universal than it is. But it's a decent mirror and if it fits your handle bars it should serve you well. I would buy another for bars that fit and will probably see if I can find a way to make this one work on my hybrid.
customer_reviews.author: picky

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Seems rugged. Good size. Unfortunately, the mirror is more than a bit fuzzy, even after I took off the protective film! My helmet mirror is much clearer. Here's my update after using the mirror for about six weeks: Literally gone with the wind. Despite tightening it over and over, it eventually flew off my bike and is nowhere to be found. Bummer. Got used to having a mirror. Guess I'll have to try another. My two cents: look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Jeff Schiff

customer_reviews.title: Good value and does the trick.
customer_reviews.text: It’s good but not for me, I just prefer the crisper view you get from standard mirror glass. The mirror is easy to install, adjust and holds position while riding. I crashed and the frame broke so I need to replace now and will go with standard mirror made by same company. It does the trick, just not as crisp a view as I would like.
customer_reviews.author: GSM

customer_reviews.title: Solid mirror for biking
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good mirror for biking, I can adjust it to have good view of the road and the bikers behind me. Being properly tightened there is very little shakiness with the exception of when I am going over rougher terrain, as to be expected. My only real complaint is that any sweat/water getting on it requires an after ride cleaning as it just doesn't seem to roll off very well and ends up smudging. However, I haven't found a better mirror on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Travy

customer_reviews.title: Very functional
customer_reviews.text: This mirror works well for me. Out of the box, it looks cheap. The mirror is smaller than you would think, and appears distorted. HOWEVER, in use it works quite well. Being outboard of the handlebars, it gives a clear view of approaching vehicles. The convex shape allows for a little wider view. It does require that your hand grips have a hole in the end. Not all do. I tried a helmet/glasses mounted mirror and it just didn't work for me. Maybe because of my multi-focal glasses. This mirror just works.
customer_reviews.author: SteveA

customer_reviews.title: Looks Nice, Everything Else About it Blows.
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the reflection is poor and the mirror is too small. Because it is so small you need to make extremely fine adjustments to see the part of the road that's important and it's very hard to do while riding. The swivel holding the thing in place is weak and the mirror will move from vibrations. It's just not a good product and doesn't hold a candle to my last mirror which didn't look as expensive but was bigger and better all around.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Nowetal

customer_reviews.title: Works ok but does not replace eyeglass or helmet mirror.
customer_reviews.text: This product works well for what it is. The image shows traffic behind you but is distorted. Range of motion is limited, but it is easy to adjust to the field of view as desired. I use this to look for traffic behind me, but if I see none I then look in the third eye  I recommend this product but it has limitations
customer_reviews.author: Coffee addict

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for road and mountain biking
customer_reviews.text: Im changing my review to 5 stars. I recently discovered you can adjust the tension on the mirrors with a allen wrench to keep them in place. With a small adjustment the mirrors now stay in place, and are working wel on both of my bikes. iPurchased 2 mirrors...one for my commuter bike and one for my Mountain/ Trail bike. I rate the mirror on my commuter bike as satisfactory. However, this is a unsatisfactory product for Mountain/ Trail riding. The mirror will not stay in place when going over even the smallest of bumps on the trail. I would return them , but they were cheap, and you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Riding safety improved 100%
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy that I bought this mirror and installed it on my ebike. It allows me to see the traffic coming up behind me both far and near. It's large enough to view up to two lanes. I did have to cut a hole in my grip to insert it but that was easy enough to do with a box cutter. It's stable and well made. Before this product, I tried a mirror that hooked up to my glasses (or helmet) but I found the view to be too small to be much good. I'm much more relaxed riding in traffic now as this has increased my safety greatly. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Love this mirror
customer_reviews.text: This mirror has some great qualities: it does not need a lot of readjustment once it is in position, it does not get in the way of your brake levers or any handlebar riding position, it can be easily folded in to keep it out of the way when transporting or parking your bike, it seems to be durable, and provides a broad view of what is approaching from behind. The only possible negative I can think of is that it would not be real easy to routinely take it off your bike if you have a need to do that.
customer_reviews.author: RR Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 2 weeks then fell a part just because of some really rough roads.would not recommend,or you’ll end up like me.Having to purchase a replacement.Food for thought.
customer_reviews.author: BRONX KID moved to FLorida

customer_reviews.title: great mirror, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: this was ready to go out of the box. could not have been easier to install. ive ridden some pretty bumpy roads on my gravel bike and this mirror has held its position perfectly. i had a small learning curve to look down for the mirror, but quickly got used to it. i also bout a Take a Look helmet mirror thinking it would be better to just glance sideways, i found it to be a piece of crap and never was able to get it installed on my helmet where i could see anything. the Hafny Bar End mirror is plenty good for me!
customer_reviews.author: K. Antonacci

customer_reviews.title: Very adjustable, and extremely well made.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made mirror that is much more adjustable than the Third Eye, and significantly better made. I bought both the Hafny and 3rd Eye, and the Hafny is night and day higher quality. It stays secure even over rough roads, and looks great. The 3rd eye moved every time I hit a slight bump, and was difficult to keep adjusted. The Hafny stainless mirror is as clear as a glass mirror.. Mirror is installed on a city bike,
customer_reviews.author: PilotBill

customer_reviews.title: Very nice bike mirror
customer_reviews.text: I like this mirror, although I can see a situation where some might have a problem installing it. It is designed to fit into the hole at the end of the handle bar. Obviously, there are different sizes to that hole depending on the type of handlebar. The mirror comes with some extra pieces for different size handlebars. Follow the instructions and there should be no problem. I would buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: SeaHuntFan

customer_reviews.title: missing part
customer_reviews.text: I just tried to install my mirror and was missing the nut on the part that goes into the bike handle. Luckily I had one to replace it as it’s a standard size. This is the 3rd mirror I’ve bought for various bikes and like this product. Thanks. / UPDATE- After sending the seller this review, they quickly contacted me and refunded half my money for the mirror because of the missing part. Very professional thing to do in my thinking.
customer_reviews.author: D. Osterloo

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: I have been bicycling since 1995, and this is by far the best bar end mirror I have found. It installs easily and securely. It has an extraordinarily large range of motion and is easy to postilion. The mirror itself is held in place by a hex key tensioning screw which can be precisely tightened. Best of all, the mirror is virtually unbreakable, being made of highly polished stainless steel. I AM IMPRESSED!
customer_reviews.author: Kim G Campbell

customer_reviews.title: A really good mirror
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several mirrors over the years and this is probably the best one I've used. It's well built, it's a bar-end product (I have on a bike with drop bars) so easy to install and it's very secure. The mount doesn't wobble or seem loose. I ride on some rough roads so the mirror does vibrate a little which makes it a little difficult to see traffic if the cars are still a ways off but I don't know how you would fix that. All in all, it's a really good mirror and I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Rockjocky

customer_reviews.title: Hafny>Mirrycle
customer_reviews.text: Look no further, I did what you wanted. I bough both Mirrycle and Hafny, heres my thoughts, I bought a pack of 4 Mirrycle and 2/4 came broken/used. Before I sent them back I installed them and heres what I learned, you have to puzzle them together which was super annoying, that aside the mirror was small and not up to standard...which is where Hafny comes in, easy to install, large and not too many moving parts.
customer_reviews.author: chong

customer_reviews.title: Good little mirror.
customer_reviews.text: I have to travel on routes with a fair amount of vehicular traffic. And noticed that turning to look behind me inevitably meant I steered a bit to the left too. This little mirror makes it easy to check if there are cars approaching (or if my teenage son is keeping up). The road vibrations means you have to adjust the angle of the mirror periodically on a ride (easy to do). And road vibrations means the image isn’t as clear as on a car side view mirror but it is certainly good enough to discern oncoming cars. Position is perfect on my old school flat mountain bike handlebars.
customer_reviews.author: AK-NJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Bar End Mirror
customer_reviews.text: I ride a lot of heavily trafficked roads and so I want to keep on eye on what is coming up behind me, all of the mirrors that I've tried "slip" and require you to take your hands off the bars and adjust them. NOT THIS ONE, it locks into place and stays, just glance down and you can see whats behind you every time. Highly recommend this mirror.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Milligan

customer_reviews.title: Works so well that I immediately bought a second one
customer_reviews.text: I am just getting back onto a bike after 5 decades of not riding. Putting this mirror on my bike made it possible to ride without constantly having to twist around to see what might be behind me. It made a huge difference in my comfort and confidence levels. After riding with this mirror for the first time I immediately bought a second one for the other side. I am using this on a Ride Scoozy brand VeeGo 750 ebike. So far it seems to be sturdy, easily adjustable and exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Paul in the NW

customer_reviews.title: Extremely distorted view. Returned.
customer_reviews.text: Mirror is extremely distorted, not just convex, but uneven, like a fun house mirror. Makes it impossible to view objects clearly or judge distance. The armature is very compact and easy to adjust, for what it's worth. The distortion view made it unusable and the item was returned.
customer_reviews.author: Submitter

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. Mounted solidly in the left drop bar, easy to adjust and holds its position with no real vibration. They make two models, the one I got with the steel mirror and a slightly more expensive model with real glass. I find the steel model to be all I need to monitor passing vehicles. I feel sorry for the people who had theirs fall out. Guess they didn't tighten it properly. Don't over torque, it is all plastic, but reasonable torque and it won't come loose. Going to get 2 or 3 more so I have one on every bike.
customer_reviews.author: Pop N Wood

customer_reviews.title: Hafny Bar End Mirror works -- but --
customer_reviews.text: Hafny Bar End mirror installs easily and securely. The fasteners are a bit loose but easy to tighten up. The only complaint I have about the mirror is the fact that the stainless steel mirror is not as optically clear as other mirrors I have installed on bikes. Forget the fact that the mirror is a wide view (re: "Objects Appear In Mirror Further Away Than They Actually Are"). The image just isn't particularly sharp, and it's harder to pick up cars way down the road than other mirrors I've purchased. That being said, I'm still keeping it on the bike. Overall, it's a good design. I'm just not sure bright stainless steel works as well as other reflective materials.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce B.

customer_reviews.title: Decent mirror
customer_reviews.text: Note that this mirror is a bit parabolic -- I didn't realize at first and had to get used to it. But it's safer than just a regular mirror! It fit well in my handlebars thanks to the expander. Doesn't get in the way of riding/braking. Remember to tighten the mirror well at the angle you want, I neglected to at first and the mirror ket flopping down going over every bump in the road. Overall satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mirror!
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical but the reviews were true and I believed them. The mirror is great quality and very easy to install. It stays in place and after two long rides now, it hasn't moved and provides a quality image. It is also easy to adjust and stays put when you move it. I was skeptical about the image quality since it is stainless and not glass, but it works great! As I said, good image! I am buying another!!
customer_reviews.author: McHeart

customer_reviews.title: Very nice little mirror
customer_reviews.text: I installed this into the end of the handlebar of a Rad Mini Fat bike. I’ve been riding it on dirt/gravel roads. I fully expected the mirror to vibrate to the point I wouldn’t be able to see much but I was wrong, this little mirror is great. It is small, easy to install, and it works very well. I have another electric bike ordered for my wife and I’m buying another of these mirrors for her.
customer_reviews.author: David Ellison

customer_reviews.title: Put on my road bike
customer_reviews.text: I put this on my Specialized road bike handlebar. I had a different mirror on it but it seemed to vibrate all the time and move. I was constantly having to adjust the mirror. This Hafny bar end mirror is a lot better. It stays put and I don't have to constantly adjust the mirror. It was simple to install. I didn't have a problem with my knees hitting the mirror. I'd purchase it again if I ever need another bike mirror. I'm happy with it. Yeah!
customer_reviews.author: NVDarkfrog

customer_reviews.title: Great product - stable view, folds for storage
customer_reviews.text: This is a great bike mirror. Very clear images at all speeds even on back roads with broken pavement. I did have to tighten the mirror tension screw to get it to stay in place while riding, but it still pivots easily. I mounted this on my tandem bike that I store in the garage on the floor. Having the ability to fold the mirror is the perfect solution to allow the bike to lean against the wall without risking damage to the mirror. Well worth the price. No regrets
customer_reviews.author: Chris Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Have to look down to far to focus on mirror image.
customer_reviews.text: Most pedal bikes the handle bars are at the same level as the knees and this mirror from the only mount position is still to small for me to have to take my eyes off the road ahead and it seems easier still to just turn my head back.
customer_reviews.author: Private

customer_reviews.title: Build quality is least reliable
customer_reviews.text: The bottom part of bike mirror over two months has become distorted. Neither the bike nor the mirror have been in accidents. So this is a strange phenomenon. Mounting the bike mirror was a breeze, however the quality and build of the mirror is highly questionable. I am past my return/refund date on this. Not sure if the company will send a replacement. Spend your money wisely and buy a better quality mirror that should last as long as you dont crash your bike or the mirror.
customer_reviews.author: Harshil Shah

customer_reviews.title: Good to Have
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install (no need for any tool). Doesn't block my handle bar. The one I bought is the smaller one so it is pretty small. It still does the job of allowing me to see what's behind me without having to turn my head around. The only reason I took off 1 star (maybe I just haven't figured out the right spot) it's easily blocked by my hand. I have to shift my hand down a bit to see the mirror fully.
customer_reviews.author: Zee K

customer_reviews.title: Love these (bought 2)
customer_reviews.text: Love these (bought 2). Have them set up so I can see behind out of one or the other whether I'm upright or crouched. If you hate being surprised by close passes or you want to see that phone-using, lane wanderer creeping up from behind, these are invaluable. A little glass cleaner or vinegar cleans them to a shine. Two-axis on-the-go adjustments means you can tune them in perfectly. Installation on any size grip is as easy as turning an Allen wrench (5mm). Did I mention that I love these?
customer_reviews.author: Matronista

customer_reviews.title: Best bike mirror I've ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: Best bike mirror I've ever owned! Good price. Looks indestructible. Easy to adjust but very stable ball joint is simple and overall mirror is unobtrusive. Slight distortion in mirror, but not important for this application.
customer_reviews.author: Leadfoot

customer_reviews.title: Excellent little mirror
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little mirror. I use it on my touring bike with flat handlebars and the GP 5 hand grips. There is almost no distortion and I can easily see the mirror no matter where I place my hands on the multi-positional grips, and whether I'm standing in the pedals or seated. It gives an excellent view of traffic behind me. It is easily installed and you can control how tightly it is adjusted. I have it loose enough to adjust while riding yet tight enough that it doesn't vibrate out of position when I hit rough patches of road. I have used it on several rides now and it is incredibly useful. I highly recommend it at the price.
customer_reviews.author: mac

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Bike Mirror
customer_reviews.text: Review of Hafny Bar End Bike Mirror, Stainless Steel, Safe Rearview Mirror, MR083 (Black) Fantastic product! This mirror is fantastic because it is small, low profile, easily installed in a 15mm inside diameter bar end handlebar, easily adjust to optimal rear-view position and holds tight over bumps, folds neatly out of the way, and is priced right! I purchased two of these and could not be more pleased. Only used it a couple of times and so far no negatives.
customer_reviews.author: Raleigh man

customer_reviews.title: I'm comfortable depending on this mirror
customer_reviews.text: Because the mirror is mounted externally to the handlebar, it always has a clear view of what is behind. I admit it is small, but I can always see the vehicle coming from behind. You probably can't tell what kind of car it is, but why would you need that. It is convenient and does the job with the least use of the handlebar space. That was a big plus for my Lectric eBike handlebar.
customer_reviews.author: Bud Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I love this mirror! I had a different kind before that worked ok but was cumbersome and moved around too much. This was easy to install and is stable no matter how long and rough the ride is. I tow my daughter in a trailer and this makes it easy to keep an eye on her and the coming traffic. I like that it folds at the end of the ride so it doesn’t risk getting broken off in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Easy install perfect fit scwinn hybrid bike flat handle bar
customer_reviews.text: Took less than 5 min to install, could adjust easily and perfectly for the convenient rear view stays firm in place no issues - Schwinn flat hybrid handle bar - just remove the schwinn cap from handle bar end using a flat screwdriver carefully and store it away, twist and remove extra plastic shim from Hafny as you don’t need it for the handle hole size and using supplied Allen tool screw in the mirror into the handle, tighten the other screw after setting the mirror for your rear view setting Nothing to it
customer_reviews.author: Shrikant Kulahalli

customer_reviews.title: Good mirror
customer_reviews.text: I've tried other mirrors mounted to eyeglasses, wrist, etc. and found all of them to be lacking in usefulness. However, this one has installed easily into the end of my bars and provides a much better view than any of the aforementioned types of mirrors which I tried. Looking forward to many miles of a much better and easier view of those sneaking up behind me.
customer_reviews.author: M. Norman

customer_reviews.title: The mirror does what it is supposed to do.  But you may have to use duct tape.
customer_reviews.text: Inside The handle bar mirror is nice to have. They could have done something to make it fit tighter inside the tube. I had to wrap duct tape around the unit several times, then push it into the handle bar, and then tighten it. Otherwise the thing fell out while riding on ruff roads. Once I installed it with the duct tape, it never has fallen out and works really good.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Great visibility
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install I use one on each side one for a low rear view/close up, I then have a top mirror on the left side for distance back and then use another one of these mirrors on the right hand side for close up in the event that a bicycle is passing me on the right. With this I have zero blind spots I wholeheartedly recommend this arrangement for everybody.
customer_reviews.author: Janos Sz.

customer_reviews.title: Quite good, often the best for a road bike
customer_reviews.text: It is not the best yet, not as good as a mirror that mounts to the tip of brake/shifter, but not far from it either. This mirror however has a major advantage in that it could be fitted to the bar end of virtually any road bike. Removing it from a bike and re-fixing it to another bike is also super easy. This mirror is therefore quite often the best choice for a road bike.
customer_reviews.author: oldyan

customer_reviews.title: Requires bike tools to install - NOT INCLUDED
customer_reviews.text: Unable to install this mirror as it requires a special bike tool (allen wrench), which is NOT included. Since we do numerous DIY projects around the house, we had 2 different size allen wrenches , but apparently we need a "special size" allen wrench to install this. Unless you work on your own bike and already have a bike tool kit, this product isn't for you.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen P

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, excellent stability, and great visibility!
customer_reviews.text: After careful deliberation I went with the smaller radius mirror and am very happy with my decision. I think the larger mirror would have been too big. I have an excellent field of view behind me and the mirror is very stable. Even when riding over rough terrain on my road bike it does not rattle or shift orientation. I highly recommend this mirror, especially if you have a road bike.
customer_reviews.author: Magnus

customer_reviews.title: Great Mirror, easy install.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this mirror out of the box. It installed very easily. Much better than the Third Eye mirror I've been using for years (broke every 6 months so I've owned several). Plus it easy to adjust out and about with a multi tool and holds firmly in place. But, and there's always a but, the mirror image is hard to see when moving along on rough roads. I contacted the seller about this issue. They rectified the problem immediately. Great communication and service. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kodiak

customer_reviews.title: Missing Allen Wrench
customer_reviews.text: Good product, and easy to install, but only if you have a 5mm allen wrench. Instructions on the box say to use that wrench to install, so I assumed it was in the box. It wasn't, but I have a set of allen wrenches, so it was easy. Instructions online and on the box should say that it is necessary, but is not included. (unless I received 2 boxes that mistakenly did not have wrenches)
customer_reviews.author: jkirkmd

customer_reviews.title: Essential Safety Item
customer_reviews.text: This mirror makes riding in traffic much safer and less stressful. Just what I needed. I tried the Third Eye bar end mirror and this one is much better (bigger and more out of the way).
customer_reviews.author: E. Frank Ball

product_meta.title: Hafny Bar End Bike Mirror, Stainless Steel Lens, Safe Rearview Mirror
feature_bullets: UNBREAKABLE STAINLESS STEEL LENS - perfect for commuting bikes to prevent hitting from breaking the lens
WIDE RANGE FITTING: Fits 14.8~23 mm inside diameter of the handlebar (OPEN ENDED GRIPS or CUT A HOLE). *****Doesn't work for Trek Isozone grips. *****
UNIVERSAL DESIGN - Can be installed on both left & right, and top of the handlebar & below the handlebar
ALL TYPES OF BIKES - Road bikes, MTB, E-bikes and etc. 5mm hex key required for installation.
Made in Taiwan, Patented, Passed EU REACH test (Chemical Test) to ensure it is safe to use the products
